item.title: Andrey Makarevich
item.description: Andrey Vadimovich Makarevich PAR is a Soviet and Russian rock musician and the founder of Russia's oldest still active rock band Mashina Vremeni.

item.title: Giorgio Gaber
item.description: Giorgio Gaber, byname of Giorgio Gaberscik, was an Italian singer, composer, actor, and playwright. He was also an accomplished guitar player and author of one of the first rock songs in Italian. With Sandro Luporini, he pioneered the musical genre known as teatro canzone.

item.title: Oleg Mityaev
item.description: Oleg Grigorievich Mityaev is a Russian bard, musician and actor.

item.title: Vladimir Vysotsky
item.description: Vladimir Semyonovich Vysotsky was a Soviet singer-songwriter, poet, and actor whose career had an immense and enduring effect on Soviet culture. He became widely known for his unique singing style and for his lyrics, which featured social and political commentary in often humorous street jargon. He was also a prominent stage and screen actor. Though his work was largely ignored by the official Soviet cultural establishment, he achieved remarkable fame during his lifetime, and to this day exerts significant influence on many of Russia's popular musicians and actors years after his death.

item.title: Facundo Cabral
item.description: Facundo Cabral was an Argentine singer, songwriter and philosopher.

item.title: Yuri Loza
item.description: Yuri Eduardovich Loza is a Russian singer, poet, and composer.

item.title: Igor Talkov
item.description: Igor Vladimirovich Talkov, was a Russian rock singer-songwriter.

item.title: Aleksandr Marshal
item.description: Aleksandr Vitalyevich Minkov, better known by stage name Alexander Marshal(Russian: Александр Маршал), is a Russian singer, songwriter, and musician; Honored Artist of the Russian Federation (2007).

item.title: Yegor Letov
item.description: Igor Fedorovich 'Yegor' Letov was a Russian poet, musician, singer-songwriter, audio engineer and conceptual art painter, best known as the founder and leader of the post-punk/psychedelic rock band Grazhdanskaya Oborona. He was also the founder of the conceptual art avant-garde project Kommunizm and psychedelic rock outfit Egor i Opizdenevshie. Letov collaborated with singer-songwriter Yanka Dyagileva and other Siberian underground artists as a record engineer and producer.

item.title: Semyon Slepakov
item.description: Semyon Sergeyevich Slepakov is a Russian-Jewish producer, screenwriter and comedian who was in the past captain of the KVN team Sbornaya Pyatigorska. He with two other comedians created the show Nasha Russia, TV-series Interns, Univer, Univer. New Dorm, SashaTanya. He also had a cameo role in the film Our Russia. The Balls of Fate.
